error.signature: You have exceeded the maximum volume limit for this account
error.regex: (exceeded the maximum volume limit|VolumeLimit[Ee]xceeded|Maximum number of volumes reached)

verdict.summary: AWS account has reached the EBS volume limit for the region. Default limit varies by volume type.

dead_ends.action: Create volumes in the same region hoping the limit resets
dead_ends.why_fails: Limits are per-region and do not reset on their own; you must request an increase or clean up

dead_ends.action: Use a different volume type to bypass the limit
dead_ends.why_fails: Each volume type has its own limit, but total storage quota may still be hit

workarounds.action: Request a service quota increase for EBS volumes via AWS Service Quotas
workarounds.how: aws service-quotas request-service-quota-increase --service-code ebs --quota-code L-D18FCD1D --desired-value NEW_LIMIT

workarounds.action: Delete unused or detached EBS volumes to free up quota
workarounds.how: aws ec2 describe-volumes --filters Name=status,Values=available | find detached volumes and delete them

leads_to.condition: Hitting EBS limits often correlates with hitting EC2 instance limits

preceded_by.condition: General limit exceeded error before specific EBS volume limit

frequently_confused_with.distinction: LimitExceeded is a general quota error; EBS volume limit is specific to Elastic Block Store volume count or storage
